snippet: Five studies presented this month provide striking evidence that when a person’s walk gets slower or becomes more variable or less controlled, his cognitive function is also suffering.
abstract: Five studies presented at the Alzheimer’s Association International Conference in Vancouver provide striking evidence that changes in an older person's gait appear to be an early indicator of cognitive impairment, including Alzheimer's disease.
lead_paragraph: Five studies presented this month provide striking evidence that when a person’s walk gets slower or becomes more variable or less controlled, his cognitive function is also suffering.

headline.seo: Signs of Cognitive Decline and Alzheimer’s Are Seen in Gait
headline.main: Footprints to Cognitive Decline and Alzheimer’s Are Seen in Gait
headline.print_headline: Footprints to Cognitive Decline and Alzheimer’s Are Seen in Gait
